description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期以山西为根据地的军阀派系，由阎锡山于1911年创立，统治山西长达38年，直至1949年因傅作义投共而消亡。
description.en: A warlord clique based in Shanxi during the Republic of China era, founded by Yan Xishan in 1911. It ruled Shanxi for 38 years until its demise in 1949 following Fu Zuoyi's defection to the Communists.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，晋系军阀的创始人和最高领导人。长期统治山西，被称为“山西王”。美国《时代杂志》在1930年称其为“模范督军”，为山西带来了繁荣。
description.en: A Chinese warlord and politician, founder and supreme leader of the Jin clique. He ruled Shanxi for a long period and was known as the "King of Shanxi". Time Magazine in 1930 called him a "model governor" who brought prosperity to Shanxi.

description.zh-cn: 推翻中国最后一个帝制王朝清朝、建立共和制的革命。
description.en: A revolution that overthrew China's last imperial dynasty, the Qing dynasty, and established the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国省份，晋系军阀的根据地。
description.en: A province of China, the base of the Jin warlord clique.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国建国初期的中央政府，由北洋军阀所控制。
description.en: The central government of the early Republic of China, controlled by the Beiyang warlords.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一任正式大总统，北洋军阀的奠基人。
description.en: The first formal president of the Republic of China and the founder of the Beiyang Army.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯试图恢复帝制的政治运动。
description.en: Yuan Shikai's political movement to restore the monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 由中国国民党建立的中华民国国民政府。
description.en: The national government of the Republic of China established by the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 晋系重要将领，后在第二次国共内战末期率部投向中国共产党。
description.en: An important general of the Jin clique who later defected with his troops to the Chinese Communist Party at the end of the Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 由阎锡山设立的军火工厂，曾与汉阳兵工厂、奉天兵工厂并列为全国三大兵工厂。
description.en: An arsenal established by Yan Xishan, once ranked among the three largest arsenals in China along with Hanyang Arsenal and Fengtian Arsenal.

description.zh-cn: 由阎锡山设立的军火工厂。
description.en: An arsenal established by Yan Xishan.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山在辛亥革命时指挥的北洋军部队，是响应起义并开创晋系的基础力量。
description.en: The Beiyang Army unit commanded by Yan Xishan during the Xinhai Revolution, which was the foundational force that responded to the uprising and created the Jin clique.

description.zh-cn: 清末第43混成协协统，在辛亥革命太原起义中被阎锡山部击毙。
description.en: The commander of the 43rd Mixed Brigade in the late Qing Dynasty, killed by Yan Xishan's troops during the Taiyuan Uprising of the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 清末山西省巡抚，在辛亥革命太原起义中被阎锡山部击毙。
description.en: The governor of Shanxi Province in the late Qing Dynasty, killed by Yan Xishan's troops during the Taiyuan Uprising of the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 清末北洋陆军的常备军之一，曾攻击辛亥革命后的山西革命军。
description.en: One of the standing armies of the Beiyang Army in the late Qing Dynasty, which attacked the Shanxi revolutionary army after the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 晋系高级将领，曾任军团总指挥、军长等职。
description.en: A senior general of the Jin clique who served as army group commander-in-chief, army commander, and other positions.

description.zh-cn: 1927年晋系军队易帜后采用的番号，后改编为国民革命军第三集团军。
description.en: The designation adopted by the Jin clique's army after switching allegiance in 1927, later reorganized into the Third Group Army of the National Revolutionary Army.

nodes.id: 国民革命军第三集团军

zh-cn: 国民革命军第三集团军
en: Third Group Army of the National Revolutionary Army

description.zh-cn: 1928年由国民革命军北方军改编而成的晋系军队番号。
description.en: The designation of the Jin clique's army, reorganized from the Northern Army of the National Revolutionary Army in 1928.

description.zh-cn: 1927年爆发于奉系军阀与晋系军阀之间的战争。
description.en: A war that broke out in 1927 between the Fengtian warlord clique and the Jin warlord clique.

description.zh-cn: 即奉系军阀，民国军阀派系之一，以张作霖为首。
description.en: The Fengtian warlord clique, one of the warlord factions of the Republic of China, led by Zhang Zuolin.

description.zh-cn: 1930年国民政府内部爆发的规模最大的军阀战争，阎锡山为反蒋联军总司令之一，战败后短暂下野。
description.en: The largest warlord war within the Nationalist government in 1930. Yan Xishan was one of the commanders of the anti-Chiang coalition and briefly stepped down after his defeat.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀领袖张作霖之子，东北军的领导者。中原大战后曾负责整编晋绥军。
description.en: Son of Fengtian warlord leader Zhang Zuolin and leader of the Northeastern Army. He was responsible for reorganizing the Jin-Sui Army after the Central Plains War.

description.zh-cn: 日本关东军在中国东北蓄意制造并发动的一场侵华战争，是日本帝国主义侵华的开端。
description.en: An invasion of China deliberately staged and launched by the Japanese Kwantung Army in Northeast China, marking the beginning of Japanese imperialism's invasion of China.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山在山西设立的最高军事指挥机构。
description.en: The highest military command organization established by Yan Xishan in Shanxi.

description.zh-cn: 中国抗日战争时期，中华民国国民政府划分的战区之一，主要由晋绥军组成，司令长官为阎锡山。
description.en: One of the war zones designated by the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War, mainly composed of the Jin-Sui Army, with Yan Xishan as the commander.

description.zh-cn: 由阎锡山建立的，统一领导第二战区军政民各部门工作的带有政党性质的政治组织。
description.en: A political organization with party-like characteristics established by Yan Xishan to uniformly lead the work of military, political, and civilian departments in the Second War Zone.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山在1938年2月之前统治山西的领导组织，后改组为民族革命同志会。
description.en: The leading organization through which Yan Xishan ruled Shanxi before February 1938, later reorganized into the Revolutionary Comrades Association.

description.zh-cn: 晋系高级将领，曾任军团总指挥、军长等职。
description.en: A senior general of the Jin clique who served as army group commander-in-chief, army commander, and other positions.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山于1911年年底辛亥革命之际响应起义，创立了晋系。
description.en: In late 1911, during the Xinhai Revolution, Yan Xishan responded to the uprising and founded the Jin clique.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山是晋系军阀的创始人和最高领导人。
description.en: Yan Xishan was the founder and supreme leader of the Jin warlord clique.

description.zh-cn: 晋系以山西为根据地，并统治山西长达38年之久。
description.en: The Jin clique was based in Shanxi and ruled it for 38 years.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命爆发时，时任北洋军标统的阎锡山响应起义，掌握了山西的政权，从而开创了“晋系”。
description.en: When the Xinhai Revolution broke out, Yan Xishan, then a regiment commander in the Beiyang Army, responded to the uprising and seized power in Shanxi, thus creating the "Jin clique".

description.zh-cn: 晋系在1927年前与北洋政府有千丝万缕的联系。
description.en: The Jin clique had intricate ties with the Beiyang government before 1927.

description.zh-cn: 1927年6月，阎锡山宣布山西易帜，晋系效忠国民政府。
description.en: In June 1927, Yan Xishan announced that Shanxi would switch its allegiance, and the Jin clique pledged loyalty to the Nationalist government.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山曾拥戴袁世凯洪宪称帝。
description.en: Yan Xishan once supported Yuan Shikai's attempt to become emperor.

description.zh-cn: 1949年，傅作义投向中国共产党。
description.en: In 1949, Fu Zuoyi defected to the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 傅作义投向共产党导致晋系消亡。
description.en: Fu Zuoyi's defection to the Communists led to the demise of the Jin clique.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山设立了太原兵工厂以发展军火工业。
description.en: Yan Xishan established the Taiyuan Arsenal to develop the armaments industry.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山设立了山西火药厂以发展军火工业。
description.en: Yan Xishan established the Shanxi Powder Factory to develop the armaments industry.

description.zh-cn: 在辛亥革命太原起义中，阎锡山指挥的第86标击毙了第43混成协协统谭振德。
description.en: During the Taiyuan Uprising of the Xinhai Revolution, the 86th Standard commanded by Yan Xishan killed Tan Zhende, the commander of the 43rd Mixed Brigade.

description.zh-cn: 在辛亥革命太原起义中，阎锡山指挥的第86标击毙了山西省巡抚钟琦。
description.en: During the Taiyuan Uprising of the Xinhai Revolution, the 86th Standard commanded by Yan Xishan killed Zhong Qi, the governor of Shanxi.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命后，山西革命军遭到大清陆军第三镇攻击，战力大为受创。
description.en: After the Xinhai Revolution, the Shanxi revolutionary army was attacked by the 3rd Town of the Qing Army and suffered heavy losses.

description.zh-cn: 1916年护国战争后，阎锡山收编了商震的陕西旅。
description.en: After the National Protection War in 1916, Yan Xishan incorporated Shang Zhen's Shaanxi brigade.

description.zh-cn: 1927年6月3日，阎锡山宣布山西易帜，12万山西陆军（晋系军队）改编为国民革命军北方军。
description.en: On June 3, 1927, Yan Xishan announced Shanxi's change of allegiance, and the 120,000-strong Shanxi Army (Jin clique army) was reorganized into the Northern Army of the National Revolutionary Army.

relationships.target: 国民革命军第三集团军

description.zh-cn: 1928年2月28日，晋军（时称国民革命军北方军）被改编为国民革命军第三集团军。
description.en: On February 28, 1928, the Jin Army (then known as the Northern Army of the National Revolutionary Army) was reorganized into the Third Group Army of the National Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 1927年9月，晋系与奉系之间爆发奉晋战争。
description.en: In September 1927, the Fengtian-Jin War broke out between the Jin clique and the Fengtian clique.

description.zh-cn: 中原大战中阎锡山战败下野。
description.en: Yan Xishan was defeated in the Central Plains War and forced to step down.

description.zh-cn: 中原大战后，张学良将晋绥军（晋系军队）的14个军40余师压缩为4个军8个师，削弱了其力量。
description.en: After the Central Plains War, Zhang Xueliang downsized the Jin-Sui Army (Jin clique army) from 14 armies and over 40 divisions to 4 armies and 8 divisions, weakening its strength.

description.zh-cn: 九一八事变爆发后，南京国民政府无暇顾及阎锡山，为他重返山西创造了条件。
description.en: After the Mukden Incident, the Nanjing Nationalist Government was too preoccupied to deal with Yan Xishan, creating conditions for his return to Shanxi.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山于1932年2月设立太原绥靖公署并就任主任。
description.en: Yan Xishan established the Taiyuan Pacification Headquarters in February 1932 and assumed the position of Director.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争期间，阎锡山担任第二战区司令长官。
description.en: During the Second Sino-Japanese War, Yan Xishan served as the Commander of the Second War Zone.

description.zh-cn: 1947年2月，第二战区长官部改组为太原绥靖公署。
description.en: In February 1947, the headquarters of the Second War Zone was reorganized into the Taiyuan Pacification Headquarters.

description.zh-cn: 民族革命同志会的前身是“自强救国同志会”。
description.en: The predecessor of the Revolutionary Comrades Association was the "Self-Strengthening National Salvation Comrades Association".
